channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog fouling, 20th September
item.description:
I am making another report as the other one was closed within 2 hours saying ‘resolved’ and absolutely nothing has changed? There are three dog poos within 50m on Castledine road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castledine Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all over pavement & road, 20th September
item.description:
Includes foul smelling meat packets

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glyn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgraceful state of thicket road, 20th September
item.description:
The amount of dead leaves, Flytipped rubbish and general detritus along thicket road (opposite and around the entrance to the currently closed entrance to the park) is absolutely shameful. I have lived in several boroughs and this area by far has the poorest standard of street cleaning, it’s like it’s been purposefully left to degrade. What is happening on this road as according to the council website it is cleaned twice per week which is categorically NOT happening. It needs regular cleaning with a sweeper and litter picking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Garbage by bins every weekend, 20th September
item.description:
Like clockwork every weekend tons of litter outside of garbage bins. Not sure if because residents don’t dispose of stuff properly or someone drags it out but bins are clearly not fit for purpose

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brenthouse Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow plastic barriers strewn all over the place, 20th September
item.description:
Can they either be removed or positioned properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerously leaning tree in the garden behind 4 St Leonards Square, 20th September
item.description:
The huge eucalyptus tree in the garden behind no. 4 is leaning at a more and more extreme angle. It has lent over for many years, but as it grows taller the lean becomes more alarming. I live in no 8, and if it fell it would easily reach us, and do considerable damage to the back of our (and the neighbours in between) property. Please can it be taken out, or chopped back severely? Each time we get windy weather I watch it and worry. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Leonard's Square, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Acacia tree in pavement between 4/5 Acacia Close, 20th September
item.description:
New request of shoots coming from base of acacia tree in pavement between 4/5Acacia Close BR5 1LL together with fallen branch landing in garden of no. 4. ALSO Many branches are over hanging my front garden of no. 5 Acacia Close causing an extra nuisance of lots of dead wood continually falling onto front area of no. 5. Photos taken of the shoots are new from previous complaint. Plus fallen branch landing in garden of no.4

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Acacia Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verges overgrown with rubbish, 20th September
item.description:
The grass verge on the bexley side of the cemetery from Lodge hill junction with Totnes road down the hill is a disgrace. Combination of rubbish and fly tipped rubbish bags overgrown weeds and leaves combine with over tress which not only stop the street light working but are hanging so low lorries hit them This has been reported every month nothing done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Exmouth Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another mattress dumped, 20th September
item.description:
Another mattress dumped at this point to join the rolled up mattress I reported over a week ago which is behind the big mattress in the photo. This is becoming a regular dumping spot. Please can a warning notice be put at this point ? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanstead Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human faces, urine, pigeon droppings, 20th September
item.description:
Clevedon Passage has human feces, stinks of urine, and is lined with pigeon droppings. It needs to be pressure washed regularly. Residences open out onto it and it's like walking through a toilet daily. It's a health hazard

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington High Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
